objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The primary organization that authored or published this report.

objects.name: Hardcoded C2 IP
objects.description: The IP address is the hardcoded default C2 present in the UMBRELLA STAND sample.

objects.name: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling make use of this hidden directory.

objects.name: Persistence mechanism via ld.so.preload
objects.description: The presence of the string /data2/.ztls/libguic.so in /etc/ld.so.preload suggests persistence is achieved through using ldpreload to load libguic.so.

objects.name: Temporary file used by UMBRELLA STAND
objects.description: The malware writes results to this file path.

objects.name: Temporary ini file used by UMBRELLA STAND
objects.description: The malware writes and reads from this ini file.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND networking binary (blghtd) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND networking binary.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary (jvnlpe) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND initialization binary (cisz) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND initialization binary.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND ldpreload library (libguic.so) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND ldpreload library.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND reboot hooker (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND reboot hooker binary.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor binary.

objects.name: Indicator for BusyBox binary (lidwok) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the BusyBox binary used by the actors.

objects.name: Indicator for Process injection tool (dskz) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the process injection tool used by the actors.

objects.name: Indicator for tcpdump binary (tdp) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the tcpdump binary used by the actors.

objects.name: Indicator for nbtscan binary (nbso) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the nbtscan binary used by the actors.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: A set of tooling designed to allow shell commands to be run on compromised embedded devices.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: A previously unknown piece of malware identified on the device.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: The producer of FortiGate 100D series firewalls targeted by UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: T1059.004
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it's process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on encrypted stack strings." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45 D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58 C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45 DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45 EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7} // Key $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45 C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52 C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45 CF DC} // IV condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and any of them }

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on strings, if string obfuscation is not present." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = {ED B8 83 20} $ = "%s/%d.sv" $ = "%s/%s.ini" $ = "%s>%s 2>&1" $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]" $ = "/data2/.ztls/" $ = "/proc/%s/status" $ = "%*s %s" $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd" $ = "89.44.194.32" $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok" condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and 5 of them }

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on strings present in tooling." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = "LoadMsg" $ = "/bin/httpsd" $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline" $ = "/tmp/logx" $ = "error" condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and all of them }

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;" $ = "ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012" condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and any of them }

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on strings." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = "/bin/httpsd" $ = "dxumbsu" $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline" $ = "/tmp/logx" $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload" $ = "loadMsg" $ ="/SYSV64564856" condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and all of them }

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on strings used to configure injection." date = "2025-06-18" strings: $ = "/SYSV64564856" $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload" $ = "version 2" $ = "init_drivercheck" condition: uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and 3 of them }

objects.name: CVE-2021-44228
objects.description: Not mentioned in the report.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
